isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Power Cylinders - Removal

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.
To prevent personal injury or death, shift transmission to park or neutral, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.
To prevent personal injury or death, allow engine to cool before working with components.
To prevent personal injury or death, disconnect ground (-) cable from battery before doing service or diagnostic procedures.

To prevent personal injury or death, do not let engine fluids stay on your skin. Clean skin and nails using hand cleaner and wash with soap and water. Wash or discard clothing and rags contaminated with engine fluids.

regulation.para: Engine fluids (oil, fuel, and coolant) may be a threat to the environment. Recycle or dispose of engine fluids and filters according to applicable regulations. Never put engine fluids in the trash, on the ground, in sewers, or bodies of water.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, do not allow connecting rod or connecting rod cap fractured mating surfaces to contact any surface other then its matched fractured surface. Contacting any other surface could cause misalignment of the mating surface, resulting in connecting rod bearing and engine failure.

calloutgroup.callout1: Crankcase piston cooling tube mounting pad (6)

note.para: The crankshaft may need to be rotated to access some piston cooling tubes.

step1.para: Remove and discard six M6 x 12 bolts, securing the piston cooling tubes to the crankcase.
Remove piston cooling tubes and discard O-rings.
